scheme_name: Prime Ministerâ€™s Fellowship for Doctoral Research
description: A prestigious initiative by the Science and Engineering Research Board, Department of Science & Technology, Government of India, aimed at advancing university research in line with industry requirements. It encourages full-time PhD scholars to pursue industry-relevant research in focus areas identified by industries and national priorities, fostering industry-academia partnerships.
benefits: Attractive scholarship (double the JRF/SRF fellowship amount)
Unique and invigorating experience for selected fellows
Mentoring through industry and academic experts via annual review meetings
Periodic mentorship sessions organized with expert external agencies
eligibility: Applicant must be a full-time PhD scholar in any recognized Indian university/institute/research laboratory.
PhD registration date should not be more than 14 months from the date of application submission.
Applicant must have a valid industry partner willing to financially support and provide guidance/mentorship for the research project.
The mutually agreed research topic must be innovative, have practical relevance, and industrial application.
Selected applicant must be willing to work with/in the supporting company as required during the project period.
Applicant must not draw any other fellowship after selection.
Applications without an industry partner will not be accepted.
documents: Required documents and details as specified in Annexure I of the Call for Proposal document (available on the portal).
Soft copies of all required documents must be uploaded online; no hard copies are needed.
